sentence.Network_en: One day I found a litter of wild kittens in our woodpile.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一天,我在木柴堆上发现一窝野猫仔.

sentence.Network_en: They ran behind a woodpile that was beneath my tree.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们跑到了我藏身的那棵树下的木料堆后面.

sentence.Network_en: He escaped misfortune by hiding in the woodpile.
sentence.Network_cn: 他躲进了柴堆,才逃过这一劫.

entry.def: A woodpile is a pile of wood that is intended to be burnt on a fire as fuel.

means.word_mean: 1. a pile or stack of wood to be used for fuel

list.explanation: 潜伏着起破坏作用的东西或人，潜在的障碍，隐患，可疑的情况，不可告人的目的

example.en: Without removing the nigger in the fence，there is no prospect of success.
example.zh: 不消除隐患是不会有希望成功的。

auth_sentence.content: Paw and Hugh went out and I figured they was going to the woodpile so Paw could whup Hugh good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Paw and Hugh went out and I figured they was going to the woodpile so Paw could whup Hugh good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Paw and Hugh went out and I figured they was going to the woodpile so Paw could whup Hugh good.

auth_sentence.content: She had no idea the old sumbitch was cheating and setting his jar on the woodpile when we was working outside.
